title: Are film scores composed after or before the film is shot? - Quora

response.answer_text: Generally most movies are composed after the shoot, though some director-composer collaborations will ‘build’ the score as they make the film (composing to locked sequences). I gather John Ottman has done this with Bryan (X-MEN/THE USUAL SUSPECTS) Singer, especially as he’s also Maestro Singer’s editor too, and I believe Hans Zimmer’s music to CRIMSON TIDE for Tony Scott was done this way too.  Sometimes, as others have said, the composer will be asked to write a musical piece well beforehand, like this – 280. JOHN BARRY - Romance for Guitar and Orchestra from DEADFALL (1968) by James McLean on Quora Instrumentalists' Club The great John Barry wrote this for the movie DEADFALL in 1968 (THE ROMANCE FOR GUITAR AND ORCHESTRA) – he’s also the conductor you see here too!  Another example was – 171. MICHAEL KAMEN – An American Symphony (from MR. HOLLAND’S OPUS) (1995) by James McLean on Quora Instrumentalists' Club AN AMERICAN SYMPHONY, composed by the loveable Michael Kamen in 1995 for MR. HOLLAND’S OPUS.  A little symphony that’s big fun!  But, as to doing the scores beforehand, Germany’s Tom Tykwer (RUN LOLA RUN, THE INTERNATIONAL, CLOUD ATLAS) does this, with his usual collaborators Johnny Klimek and Reinhold Heil, and edits his tracks to fit. Here’s the Sextet from CLOUD ATLAS –    As you may know, Maestro Tykwer co-directed CLOUD ATLAS with the Wachowskis, who were so suitably impressed at his way of working on the score that they’ve decided that this is how the music will be done on all their films in future, starting with this one –     – courtesy of Oscar-winner Michael Giacchino.  So looking forward to it! Soooo, as others have said, it varies quite a bit, but generally it’s after the film is shot.  Still, I hope this answer proves that there’s more than one way to skin a cat! (sorry Chris B!)

The two answers above are not wrong but miss a powerful instance where the picture is cut to the music (so the music is composed first).  Often a director wants to use a particular piece of music and wants that music to drive the picture.  In this case an edit of the music is brought into post production where the film's editor cuts the scene to the music. S/he will pay particular attention to the tempo of the music and may try to match particular climaxes in the music. That way, as the music builds, so does the scene.  It doesn't have to be popular music either such as what Martin Scorsese is known for. It could just be that the film's producer wants the music to drive the scene so s/he has the composer write the score first and once s/he approves it has the editor cut the music. Keep an eye/ear out for it.  It is very powerful.  Enjoy!Stuart RidgwayComposer Pyramid Digital Productions, Inc. http://pyramidmusic.com

Usually the music is recorded after the film so that the music can fit precisely to the scenes shot. Therefore you can as a musician generally see the scenes as you record, albeit out of running order.  A famous instance was ET where apparently Steven Spielberg told John Williams he would fit the film to the score he wrote for the flying scene (the chase and build up to the bike flying). Therefore that's one of my favourite pieces of film music as John Williams had creative license to create an amazing few minutes without worrying about the music fitting to the film.

Sometimes the composers start composing before filming has even started. Sometimes they compose during filming. Usually most of the score is done in post-production. John Williams says he’s never watched any of the Star Wars films, which goes to show you can compose a great film score without having watched the film. Why John Williams Has Never Seen Any Of The Star Wars Movies

The composer might work out a few themes and movements, but the actual final edit needs to be used in order to get the timing right, so the composer does not do the core part of the work until there is a complete edit. Sound editing, possible ADR recording, Foley work and so on all take place after the film is edited too.
